page.title: 022057 HARLAW MUIR (1)
page.content: {The land forms part of Penicuik {Estate.Most of the land is rough {grazing.Black-faced sheep and a few {beef cattle are kept.Some barley,oats {and hay are grown on the lower {ground.The woodlands are useful for {shelter. The road shown on the map as unfenced has recently been fenced with an electric fence. { There are no dwelling houses in this {square. The standing stone shown on the map is called the Gowk Stone. { Hill walkers use the land for {recreation. Members of a shooting syndicate shoot grouse, pheasants, rabbits and hares.
